    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:758px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox17117423">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17117423">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17117423">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Selected Reference Materials
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117423">
          <p>
           <strong>
            ENCYCLOPEDIAS, HANDBOOKS, and DICTIONARIES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <i>
             Annual review of psychology.
            </i>
            (1950- ). Stanford, CA: Annual Reviews.
            <br />
            Location:
            <a href="https://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/oclc/1435605?databaseList=1708,638">
             Online
            </a>
            or search
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu" target="_blank">
             Encompass Search
            </a>
            by title to access
            <br />
            <em>
             Note: Print also available for 1950-2009 at Main Collection (Ref.) 150.5 A615
            </em>
           </p>
           <p>
            Campbell, R.J. (2004).
            <em>
             Campbell's psychiatric dictionary
            </em>
            (8th ed.). New York: Oxford University Press.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 616.89003 C189c
           </p>
           <p>
            Craighead, W.E, and Nemeroff, C.B. (Eds.). (2001).
            <i>
             The Corsini encyclopedia of psychology and behavioral science
            </i>
            (3rd ed.). New York: Wiley.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 150.3 E562o, 2001 v.1-4
           </p>
           <p>
            Credo reference
            <br />
            Access to hundreds of reference works, including general and subject specific dictionaries, encyclopedias, fact books, guides, companions and more--all online, all searchable from one search box.
            <br />
            Location:
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.credoreference.com">
             Online
            </a>
            or search
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu" target="_blank">
             Encompass Search
            </a>
            by title to access
           </p>
           <p>
            Kazdin, A.E. (Ed.). (2000).
            <i>
             Encyclopedia of psychology.
            </i>
            Washington, DC: American Psychological Association.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 150.3 E653o v.1-8
           </p>
           <p>
            Thackery, E. and Harris, M. (Eds.). (2003).
            <em>
             The Gale encyclopedia of mental disorders
            </em>
            . Detroit, MI: Gale Group.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 616.89003 G151e v.1-2
           </p>
           <p>
            VandenBos, G.R. (Ed.). (2007).
            <em>
             APA dictionary of psychology
            </em>
            . Washington, DC: American Psychological Association.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 150.3 A639d
           </p>
           <p>
            Weiner, I.B. (Ed.). (2003).
            <em>
             Handbook of psychology
            </em>
            . New York: Wiley.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 150 H236o v.1-12
           </p>
           <p>
            Wolman, B.B. (Ed.). (1996).
            <i>
             The encyclopedia of psychiatry, psychology and psychoanalysis
            </i>
            (1st ed.). New York: Holt.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 616.89003 W865e
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            DIAGNOSTIC CRITERIA
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            DSM-IV-TR
            <br />
            American Psychiatric Association. (2000).
            <em>
             Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders
            </em>
            (4th ed., text rev.). Washington, DC: Author.
            <br />
            Location: Ready Reference 616.89 A512d4 2000
           </p>
           <p>
            DSM-IV Sourcebook
            <br />
            Widiger, T.A., et. al. (Ed.). (1994-1998).
            <i>
             DSM-IV sourcebook
            </i>
            (1st ed.). Washington, DC: American Psychiatric Association.
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 616.89075 A512d4 Suppl. v.1-4
           </p>
           <p>
            DSM-5
            <br />
            American Psychiatric Association.&nbsp;(2013).&nbsp;
            <em>
             Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders
            </em>
            (5th ed.). Arlington, VA: Author.
            <br />
            Location: Ready Reference 616.89 A512d5&nbsp;&nbsp;
           </p>
           <p>
            ICD-10
            <br />
            World Health Organization. (2010).
            <em>
             International classification of disease
            </em>
            (10th ed., 2015 revision). Retrieved from
            <a href="http://apps.who.int/classifications/icd10/browse/2015/en">
             http://apps.who.int/classifications/icd10/browse/2015/en
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            ICD-11 Beta
            <br />
            World Health Organization. (2015).
            <em>
             International classification of disease
            </em>
            (11th ed., beta draft). Rerieved from
            <a href="http://apps.who.int/classifications/icd11/browse/f/en">
             http://apps.who.int/classifications/icd11/browse/f/en
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            PDM
            <br />
            Alliance of Psychoanalytic Organizations (Ed.). (2006).
            <em>
             Psychodynamic diagnostic manual
            </em>
            . Silver Spring, MD: Interdisciplinary Council on Development and Learning Disorders.
            <br />
            Location: Ready Reference 616.89 P974d
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            SELECTED WEBSITES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            American Psychological Association
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.apa.org" target="_blank">
             http://www.apa.org
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            MedlinePlus (U.S. National Library of Medicine / National Institutes of Health)
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/" target="_blank">
             http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            National Institute of Mental Health
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.nimh.nih.gov/" target="_blank">
             http://www.nimh.nih.gov
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17117423" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17117424">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17117424">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17117424">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Scholarly Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117424">
          <p>
           <em>
            See a list of all databases via the Library Homepage &nbsp;--&nbsp; Research --&nbsp;
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/databases-az.html" target="_blank">
             Databases A to Z
            </a>
            .
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            Check the
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/psychology">
             Psychology Subject Guide
            </a>
            for other recommended databases and resources.
           </em>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=psyh" target="_blank">
             PsycINFO
            </a>
            <br />
            Premier database of scholarly and professional journals and books in psychology and related areas. Some full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise, use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <hr align="center" noshade="noshade" size="1" width="45%" />
          <p>
           <b>
            SEARCHING
           </b>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <b>
             1.
            </b>
            Start with
            <b>
             keyword searching
            </b>
            on the main screen.&nbsp; Enter keywords that describe your topic.&nbsp;
           </p>
           <p>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
            <strong>
             S
            </strong>
            <b>
             earch tips
            </b>
            to remember:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
           </p>
           <ul>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Brainstorm alternate keywords (synonyms) for your concepts. Connect synonyms with OR. Example: stress or anxiety; women or female; "academic achievement" or "educational achievement"
             </li>
             <li>
              Use
              <b>
               *
              </b>
              for truncation. Example: therap* retrieves therapy, therapies, therapeutic, etc.
             </li>
             <li>
              Use
              <b>
               " "
              </b>
              for phrase searching. Example: "obsessive compulsive disorder"
             </li>
            </ul>
           </ul>
           <p>
            <b>
             2.
            </b>
            <b>
             Browse through your results
            </b>
            .&nbsp; Click on any article that looks relevant to see more information about it.&nbsp; Read the
            <b>
             abstract
            </b>
            , summarizing the article.&nbsp;
           </p>
           <p>
            As you look through your results,
            <b>
             use them to your advantage
            </b>
            .
           </p>
           <ul>
            <ul>
             <li>
              What
              <b>
               other words
              </b>
              could you use in your next search?&nbsp; Look in the title, keywords, and abstract sections of relevant article records.
             </li>
             <li>
              What
              <b>
               subjects
              </b>
              could you use?&nbsp; Each article has been assigned subjects that describe the content of the article.&nbsp; The subject of one article should lead you to more like it.&nbsp;
             </li>
             <li>
              When you find a useful article, don't forget to look at its
              <b>
               reference list
              </b>
              .&nbsp; Is there anything there you might be able to use?
             </li>
            </ul>
           </ul>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17117424" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18458756">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18458756">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18458756">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Getting the Full Text of Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content10536644">
          <p>
           To get the full text of an article, consider the following options:
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you are in Encompass Search or a library database, look for "Check for Full Text buttons," "Access Online," or "Check eResources" buttons. These buttons will take you the full text of the article or tell you that the full text cannot be found. If the full text is not available from Trexler Library, look for buttons to request the item from another library via interlibrary loan. Or go directly to the
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           request forms.
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you have citation information for the article (i.e., journal title, article title, publication year, etc.), type the information about your article in
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           on the library website. If the library subscribes to the full text, you will be directed to the article (see first bullet above). If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           - If Trexler Library does not have access to the full text of the article, search
           <a href="http://www.google.com/scholar">
            Google Scholar
           </a>
           by article title to see if the author has made a copy freely available online. If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt10536644" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18458777">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18458777">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18458777">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Books
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17118116">
          <p>
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discovery">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           finds information by searching through a massive collection of books, scholarly journals, newspapers and magazines, dissertations, conference proceedings, music, video, maps, and more.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <p>
           To find only books, use the Books limit on the left sidebar of your search results page. Many items will be in Trexler Library; note the call number and status of the item to check its location and availability. For items not in Trexler Library, use the Interlibrary Loan to request a copy from another library.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17118116" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18458803">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18458803">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18458803">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Citing Your Sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content18457468">
          <ul>
           <li>
            For information on
            <strong>
             why to cite your sources
            </strong>
            and
            <strong>
             how to avoid plagiarism
            </strong>
            , see the
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3856388">
             Get Started with Library Research: Cite Sources
            </a>
            guide.&nbsp;
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul>
           <li>
            For information on
            <strong>
             APA Style
            </strong>
            , see:
            <ul>
             <li>
              <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/library/media/content,assets/library/docs/apa_example.pdf">
               APA Style
              </a>
              (Trexler Library, Muhlenberg College)
              <br />
              Examples of in-text and reference list citation formatting.
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/section/2/10/">
               APA Style
              </a>
              (Purdue Online Writing Lab)
              <br />
              General orientation to APA Style, plus examples of paper and citation formatting.
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="http://writing.wisc.edu/Handbook/DocAPA.html">
               APA Documentation Guide
              </a>
              (University of Wisconsin)
              <br />
              General orientation to APA Style, plus examples of paper and citation formatting.
             </li>
            </ul>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <a href="http://www.zotero.org/">
             Zotero
            </a>
            <br />
            "Free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share your research sources." Download instructions and help available on the site.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt18457468" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile4652362" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18458751">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18458751">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18458751">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need Help with Your Research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117745">
          <p>
           <em>
            Contact:
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            Jen Jarson
           </b>
           <br />
           Social Sciences Reference Librarian
           <br />
           phone: 484-664-3552
           <br />
           email: jarson@muhlenberg.edu
           <br />
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17117745" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
